page.title: 09Farming Patterns in Dyfed
page.content: Of the area's dozen and a half farms, half remain as dairy farms with herds of between thity and hundred. Friesand predominate but there is also a small herd of Jerseys and a pedigree herd of Shorthorns who are regularly champions at the Royal Welsh Show. Bef fattning and sheep breding are the most important enterprises after dairying. The sheep are of many different lowland breeds while the cattle are mainly Friesan, Hereford and Charolais. A new way of supplementing the farm income has been tried, with some success, by two armers in the area who now cater for tourists, providing self-catering accommodation or bed and breakfast in the farmhouse. At Treaes Fawr high quality Welsh cobs and Welsh Mountain ponies are bred. 40 mares are kept many are exported for breeding.
